paragraphs.body: George was born in Jerusalem, Israel, to Iraqi-Jewish parents who had immigrated to Israel from India. A year after his birth, the family moved from Israel to London and later to Toronto, Canada, in 1966. George is the youngest of four siblings.
paragraphs.text: George was born in Jerusalem, Israel, to Iraqi-Jewish parents who had immigrated to Israel from India. A year after his birth, the family moved from Israel to London and later to Toronto, Canada, in 1966. George is the youngest of four siblings.

paragraphs.body: He attended an all-boys school in London but made the switch to a public co-ed high school when the family moved to Toronto. He attended the University of Toronto, where he was active in the university's theater productions. George left before graduation and formed a theater group; unsuccessful, he moved on to join The Second City, where he trained with John Candy, among others.
paragraphs.text: He attended an all-boys school in London but made the switch to a public co-ed high school when the family moved to Toronto. He attended the University of Toronto, where he was active in the university's theater productions. George left before graduation and formed a theater group; unsuccessful, he moved on to join The Second City, where he trained with John Candy, among others.

paragraphs.body: As he ages, George is increasingly cast in one-time guest roles as the father of a principal character; for example, he played Julian Bashir's father in the Star Trek: Deep Space Nine episode "Doctor Bashir, I Presume?" and Raj's father in The Big Bang Theory. In 2006, he landed a recurring role as Sasan's father Omid on the VH1 sitcom So NoTORIous. He had a recurring role as newsman Hugh Persons on Doctor, Doctor during the series' second season and appeared as a United Nations secretary on Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery.
paragraphs.text: As he ages, George is increasingly cast in one-time guest roles as the father of a principal character; for example, he played Julian Bashir's father in the Star Trek: Deep Space Nine episode "Doctor Bashir, I Presume?" and Raj's father in The Big Bang Theory. In 2006, he landed a recurring role as Sasan's father Omid on the VH1 sitcom So NoTORIous. He had a recurring role as newsman Hugh Persons on Doctor, Doctor during the series' second season and appeared as a United Nations secretary on Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery.

paragraphs.body: He has also done voice-over work in animated shows such as Batman: The Animated Series, Kim Possible, Batman Beyond, and Justice League and has appeared in video games like Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, Baldur's Gate, Ultimate Spider-Man, Everquest II and Final Fantasy XIV. He took over the voice of Bob Fish in the British-Canadian animated comedy series Bob and Margaret and played The Inspector in the 1993 revival series of The Pink Panther.
paragraphs.text: He has also done voice-over work in animated shows such as Batman: The Animated Series, Kim Possible, Batman Beyond, and Justice League and has appeared in video games like Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, Baldur's Gate, Ultimate Spider-Man, Everquest II and Final Fantasy XIV. He took over the voice of Bob Fish in the British-Canadian animated comedy series Bob and Margaret and played The Inspector in the 1993 revival series of The Pink Panther.

paragraphs.body: Some of George's other appearances include the role of Mr. Pashmutt on Desperate Housewives in the 2005 episode "You Could Drive a Person Crazy", Ali on American Dad! in the 2005 episode "Stan of Arabia", and Captain Barbossa in the video games Kingdom Hearts II and Pirates of the Caribbean: The Legend of Jack Sparrow.
paragraphs.text: Some of George's other appearances include the role of Mr. Pashmutt on Desperate Housewives in the 2005 episode "You Could Drive a Person Crazy", Ali on American Dad! in the 2005 episode "Stan of Arabia", and Captain Barbossa in the video games Kingdom Hearts II and Pirates of the Caribbean: The Legend of Jack Sparrow.

paragraphs.body: He voiced Sahin the Falcon and Stuart Black in Age of Empires III and is the voice of Fareed "Freddie" Abdul Salaam, a taxi driver and informant, in the game True Crime: New York City. He plays a short tempered convenience store owner in the 2001 movie Ghost World and Iqbal in the 2006 movie Employee Of The Month.

He plays a short tempered convenience store owner in the 2001 movie Ghost World and Iqbal in the 2006 movie Employee Of The Month.

paragraphs.body: In The Penguins of Madagascar, George guest stars as the zoo doctor in "Needle Point", "I Was a Penguin Zombie", "Operation: Cooties" and "Love Hurts".
paragraphs.text: In The Penguins of Madagascar, George guest stars as the zoo doctor in "Needle Point", "I Was a Penguin Zombie", "Operation: Cooties" and "Love Hurts".

paragraphs.body: George appeared on That's so Raven as Dr. Sleevemore, a "psychic doctor" who treats Raven's vision-related problems, and Phineas and Ferb on the hour long special Summer Belongs To You as Uncle Sabu.
